definition: to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: These faithful guardians seemed unwilling to surrender their treasure .
sentences.chinese: 这些忠实的守卫者似乎不愿交出他们的宝藏。

sentences.english: And you're gonna need to fly a long way to get to the guardians.
sentences.chinese: 你要飞过很久的路才能到达守卫者那里。

sentences.english: We are defenders of the truth.
The Lord of Light's sacred soldiers, defenders of the temple.
sentences.chinese: 燃烧之手，光之王的神圣士兵，神庙的守卫者。

sentences.english: Lictors are sacred and were the peacekeepers of the old empire.
sentences.chinese: 行刑吏是神圣的，他们是旧帝国的和平守卫者。

sentences.english: Gan'arg Underlings and Felhound Defenders are now properly classified as demons.
sentences.chinese: 加南的手下和地狱犬守卫者现在正确的归属于恶魔。

sentences.english: They mold you for your future roles as the custodians of the Nation's defense.
sentences.chinese: 他们为了塑造你将来为保家卫国的守卫者角色。

definition: spirit of a martyr/spirit of the brave departed/person of remarkable talent
